Very simple thought for a simple problem.

Given the model KSP uses, would it be possible that if we wanted to wrap kerbin itself in highways using splines?

To break the thought down, placing objects on kerbin scales poorly. So building road networks out of individually placed and processor-hungry models would quickly become tedious and unfeasible. But how about if we placed verticies on the world sphere, and drew splines along the surface texture map between them? Then, along the splines, apply a highway 'legos' a km or so long for the interactive stuff, and for things further out, some kind of low detail line texture showing the 'highway in the distance'?

Any thoughts on something like this? It would be cool to have long highways to drive down.

I can think of other neat uses for the mechanic as well if it works. For example, place down two 'runway endcap verticies' and it would draw a spline between them and build a runway of custom size and orientation. Add a mechanic to place down a texture relating to the orientation of each endcap and you have customized runway heading numbers.

Forgive me for this but...

... will the splines be reticulated?
